extensionDescription.message: Modify the Referer header in HTTP requests

openSettings.description: Text for popup button that opens settings

target domain.description: Header for the target domain column

target domain description.message: Domain of the requested URL, also matches subdomains

origin domain.description: Header for the origin domain column

origin domain description.message: Domain of the origin of the request, also matches subdomains. Leave empty to match all.
origin domain description.description: Header for the origin domain column (tooltip)

action column description.message: What to do with the Referer in a request matching the target domain

replacement referer.description: Header for the replacement referer column

replacement referer description.message: If the action "Replace" is selected, the Referer is set to this value.
replacement referer description.description: Header for the replacement referer column (tooltip)

any rule description.message: Applies to any request that does not match one of the other rules.

same rule description.message: Applies to requests where target and origin domain are the same, unless there is a specific rule for the domain.

prune action description.message: Send only the origin part of the Referer (scheme, host, and port)

target action description.message: Send the origin of the target URL (scheme, host, and port) as Referer

replace action description.message: Replace the Referer with the string in the "Referer" field

rule up.description: Button to move the current rule up

rule up description.description: Button to move the current rule up (tooltip)

rule down.description: Button to move the current rule down

rule down description.description: Button to move the current rule down (tooltip)

config backup title.description: Title for the configuration backup/restore section

config import warning.message: ⚠️ Warning: Importing will overwrite your current configuration.
config import warning.description: Warning that config import overwrites current config

config doc.message:
Please check the tooltips for details on the meaning of the configuration fields. Domains also match subdomains, if a request matches multiple rules the longest match is used. For example, if you have separate rules for both `www.example.com` and `example.com`, a request to `https://www.example.com/` will be subject to the former rule.
The "replace" and "target" actions will add a Referer header to the request if necessary, the other actions only take effect if the browser would send one by default.
config doc.description: General user documentation on the options page

regexp doc summary.description: Title for the regexp matching documentation

regexp doc.message:
If the value of the target domain field ends with a `$` it is treated as a regular expression. The `$` is part of the expression, so your expression must match at the end of the domain. If there are multiple matches with the same length, the first rule from top is used.
Note that regular expressions are used as-is, so consider the start of the URL and subdomain boundaries. For example, `example\.com$` would match `my-example.com`. If you want to match only `example.com` use `^example\.com$`, and to match all its subdomains, too use `(^|\.)example\.com$`.
